TopicTitle: What mods should I have for 32-bit?

Articles.Content: What are some good mods to have for a 32-bit game? I played 64-bit in my 0.24 career mode and went mod happy but I am trying to only use 32-bit for 0.25 and I am having some difficulties. It keeps crashing because I keep going mod happy. It's a bad habit. Is there a good list of mods that would fit nicely in 32-bit without crashing?

It's so hard to answer this question because it depends on what you like which none of us know.

If it keeps crashing, start by making sure all PLUGIN addons are up to date and have been updated to work with 0.25 or confirmed compatible. Plugins shouldn't take much memory though so if it still crashes, you could be out of RAM in which case you can either trim your part mods or install Active Texture Management which will scale them down at the cost of appearance (slightly, I can see the difference but I have a big 1080p monitor).

Some of the culprits for RAM overload are B9 and NovaPunch, because they big textures and a lot of parts. Other smaller packs combined like FusTek or KWRocketry can add up quickly.

There are loader bugs that make TGAs take up 4-6x what they should. I would wait until ATM (which fixes that, even if you don't run aggressive mode) is updated for 0.25 before figuring out how many mods you can add.
